result.execSummary:
The defendant Lorenzo K Duncan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 4 days were granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No Contact with Cameron C.; William J.W.; or Tyler J. or any witnesses or victims listed in the criminal complaint. NO use or possession of any weapons. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours (Huber). Release for standard conditions. LAST 3 Months are STAYED for use at agent's discretion. Commencing 03/23/17 at 12pm.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: Dated 06/05/17, from clerk to the Defendant, in response to request for balance of sentence to be DRC. Request denied by Judge Carter on 06/05/17.

Received on 05/16/17, from the Defendant, requesting to convert balance of sentence to Day Report Center.

06/05/17,   per Judge Carter: Request is denied based upon seriousness of offense of conviction

Dated today, from clerk to the Defendant, in response to request for electronic monitoring. Per Judge Carter: The request is denied.  Court considered the option at the time of sentencing but rejected it due to the seriousness of the offense.
Received today, from the Defendant, requesting electronic monitoring.

(Fax) Receved on 03/23/17, from Latoya Phillips from Affinity Health Center, requesting that the Defendant be approved to work hours on attached schedule.
3/28/17, per Judge Carter:  This is a Huber facility/Jail issue.  The court will not interfere with their rules.

records.addlTxt: 2 character letters filed by Attorney Patrickus

Defendant Lorenzo K Duncan in court with Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Patrickus makes statements regarding sentencing.  Reynaldo B. makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE OF:   

TERM OF PROBATION:   3 YEARS  (4 Days credit, if revoked)

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No use or possession of any weapons 
____No contact with:  Cameron C.;  William J. W. ; or  Tyler J. or any witnesses/victims listed in criminal complaint 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($3,000.00) and balance of bail money to be refunded to poster)

CONDITION TIME:   8 MONTHS, Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence 3/23/17 by 12:00 p.m.  - LAST 3 MONTHS STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
